subject: Re: [junit] Re: ActiveTestSuite with JUnit 4.x
msgSnippet: Michael, I missed what you re saying here.  Is the overhead imposed when tests are run sequentially, or concurrently?  Thanks, David Saff
messageBody:
Michael,

I missed what you're saying here. Is the overhead imposed when tests
are run sequentially, or concurrently? Thanks,

David Saff

Michael Hüttermann wrote:
> because all tests are run sequentially, it is impossible without a big
> overhead application side.
>
> Michael
>
>
>
> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:
>
>> Michael,
>>
>> I'm not aware of one. It should be doable, and much easier once the
>> runner extension architecture is refactored. Thanks,
>>
>> David Saff
>>
>> Michael Hüttermann wrote:
>>
>>> Hello,
>>>
>>> how can I write a concurrent test suite with annotations. Is there any
>>> simple example available for that?
>>>
>>> Thanks.
>>>
>>> Michal
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>> Yahoo! Groups Links
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
